questions.question: What is the area under a cumulative distribution function?
Which of the following is NOT a property that the cumulative distribution function F(x) of a random variable X must satisfy?

answers.b: F(x)=0 when x tends to infinty

explanations.a: By definiition CDF is P(X<=x) hence lies between 0 and 1.
explanations.b: F(x)=1 when x tends to infinty because F(x)=P(X<=x).
explanations.c: CDF is the summation of the Probabilities of discrete random variables. So CDF is always non-decreasing with finitely many jump-discontinuities.

questions.question: Let X be a real random variable with F as the distribution function, then P(X in (a,b]) is given by?

explanations.a: By definition F(x)=P(X <= x), therefore F(b)-F(a) = P(X <= b)-P(X <= a)=P(X in (a,b]).

questions.question: Let X is a real continuous random variable then P(X = a) for all a in R is given by?

explanations.a: We know F(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X <= b)-P(X <= a), therefore P(X=a) = F(a)-F(a-) = 0.
explanations.b: We know F(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X <= b)-P(X <= a), therefore P(X=a) = F(a)-F(a-) = 0.
explanations.c: We know F(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X <= b)-P(X <= a), therefore P(X=a) = F(a)-F(a-) = 0.
explanations.d: We know F(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X <= b)-P(X <= a), therefore P(X=a) = F(a)-F(a-) = 0.

questions.question: Let X is a real continuous random variable, such that P(X = 1) = 0.2 and P(X=4)=0.8 then what is the probability of X lying between 1 and 4?

explanations.a: Probability of X lying between 1 and 4 = F(4)-F(1-) = 0.8-0.2=0.6.
explanations.b: Probability of X lying between 1 and 4 = F(4)-F(1-) = 0.8-0.2=0.6.
explanations.c: Probability of X lying between 1 and 4 = F(4)-F(1-) = 0.8-0.2=0.6.
explanations.d: Probability of X lying between 1 and 4 = F(4)-F(1-) = 0.8-0.2=0.6.
